title: I have idea for new champ
body: Lucian story is that thresh stole his wife right ? Why you dont do Lucian wife as champ ? it will be cool right ? :D

replies.body: She is kind of busy being in Threshs Lantern lmao...

I think she's one of the most requested non-playable lore character along with General DuCouteau.

They can bring her to League and retcon the lore, like they did for {{champion:145}} since she was also a lore character, supposed to be Kassadin's daughter.
Wait, what?
What's the confusion here about, out of curiosity?

> [{quoted}](name=Umbral Regent,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bcbb1318,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2018-10-30T21:24:09.859+0000)
>
> What's the confusion here about, out of curiosity?

Probably the fact that it has never been officially confirmed that Kai'Sa is Kassadin's daughter. The stories line up in content, sure, we don't know how common a town vanishing to the void is, nor do we know WHEN these events respectively took place. Specifically, if Kai'sa's father *had* been away, it would probably have been mentioned, and she would have know and been actively looking for him...likely for longer than those three days.

My suspicion is that they might be from the same town, certainly, but I'm not convinced they're related.

Ah. That's a fair reason.

I don't think anyone could say for certain whether or not Kai'Sa and Kassadin are related (besides Riot, anyway), but even if it's all but confirmed, there's still some pretty strong hints at the relation - namely, Kai'Sa's quotes for attacking and making her first move when Kassadin is in the same match;

> _**Attacking**_
> "_Have we met?_"
> "_You seem familiar._"
> "_Something's off here..._"
> ---
> _**First Move**_
> "_Huh...Memories of my father come at the strangest moments._"
> "_Reunions can be so bittersweet._"
> "_Could it-, be true?_"
> "_It smells like home here._"
> "_Father?_"

Although, even if they aren't related, I'd have to give props to Riot for writing a reference to the old lore - Kassadin losing his daughter, coincidentally to a sacrifice. (Although, this time, releasing the sacrifice(s) as a prank, rather than _being_ the sacrifice.)

> [{quoted}](name=Umbral Regent,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bcbb1318,comment-id=00030000000100000000,timestamp=2018-10-30T22:17:01.255+0000)...there's still some pretty strong hints at the relation...

Sure, but I think you could pass many of those off as them being from the same town as well -- a connection I feel is more certain. That would cover:

* Have we met?
* You seem familiar.
* Something's off here...
* Reunions can be so bittersweet.
* Could...be true? *(Kai'Sa thinks no one survived)
* It smells like home here.

The "Father?" line is a bit harder to explain, but that could, frankly, just be hopefulness.

At the same time it's so obvious that it doesn't really need discussion.

Don't know why Rioters are playing coy about the relationship on the surface when in every other respect they're literally beating the Kai'Sa/Kassadin relationship with a bloody stick.

> [{quoted}](name=mrmeddyman,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bcbb1318,comment-id=0003000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-30T22:47:23.869+0000)
>
> At the same time it's so obvious that it doesn't really need discussion.
> 
> Don't know why Rioters are playing coy about the relationship on the surface when in every other respect they're literally beating the Kai'Sa/Kassadin relationship with a bloody stick.

conversely his "wait, what?" could be read as "wait, what are you talking about, we didn't retcon anything and she's totally his daughter, wasn't it obvious it's not like we were especially subtle."

I don't know what any of you guys are talking about. Kassadin's wife and daughter died when their village was destroyed in a Void incursion, and he's dedicated what little is left of his life to avenging them.

I mean, it'd be ALL KINDS OF TRAGIC if his daughter wasn't dead.

I can't even BEGIN to imagine what kind of ACTUAL story we might tell about that...
I know you can't see me rolling eyes but I'm just letting you know that's what is happening right now.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bcbb1318,comment-id=000300000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-31T00:21:03.467+0000)
>
> I don't know what any of you guys are talking about. Kassadin's wife and daughter died when their village was destroyed in a Void incursion, and he's dedicated what little is left of his life to avenging them.
> 
> I mean, it'd be ALL KINDS OF TRAGIC if his daughter wasn't dead.
> 
> I can't even BEGIN to imagine what kind of ACTUAL story we might tell about that...

Honedtly this is just incredibly frustrating at this point its not even funny... League lore is incredibly static as it is and moving literally nowhere... Can we for once since league has been online,habe anything confirmed? This besting around the bush is so unnecessary and confusing... People are growing up leaving league nonody has time to sit here for 10 years to see who Kassadins daughter is ...

Oh my god... Please...

Just, why ?

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bcbb1318,comment-id=000300000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-31T00:21:03.467+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=bcbb1318,comment-id=000300000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-31T00:21:03.467+0000)

> 
> I can't even BEGIN to imagine what kind of ACTUAL story we might tell about that...

Well, personally I always feel like Kaisa **ISNT** Kass daughter, but rather a therapy doll for him.
Kai was kidnaped and, by pure luck, Kass met her in "void territory" where he save her and help her a little bit _(here is a place for a story)_ as a memento of his real daughter or as psychology mental breakdown of that broken mind. 
From kaisai point of view, it could be basic emotional deprivation and basic adherence to the caregiver, aka. Kass. But hey, it's just a funny little theory in my mind.
